text: Bromopentafluorobenzene is an organofluorine compound with the formula C6F5Br. It is a colorless liquid that is used to prepare pentafluophenyl compounds. These syntheses typically proceed via the intermediacy of C6F5Li or the Grignard reagent. Illustrative is preparation of tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane:Piers, W. E.; Chivers, T. “Pentafluorophenylboranes: from Obscurity to Applications”, Chemical Society Reviews, 1997, 26, 345-354. :3 C6F5MgBr + BCl3 → (C6F5)3B + 3 MgBrCl Other derivatives include LiB(C6F5)4, [CuC6F5]4, and Ni(C6F5)2(dioxane)2. ==References== Category:Fluoroarenes Category:Perfluorinated compounds
title: Bromopentafluorobenzene
